settings.title: Scam Alert: Fake Emails Claiming to Be Dr. Amy Morris and SurvivorRx

settings.text:
Scam Alert: Fake Emails Claiming to Be SurvivorRx

They say imitation is the sincerest form of flattery‚Ä¶ but in this case, it caused more harm than good.

We recently investigated an incident in which a third party used the SurvivorRx name without authorization. This individual created and distributed an email and online form that misrepresented an affiliation with SurvivorRx. While we do not know how many people were affected, we took immediate steps to address the situation.

The unauthorized messages included a web address that linked to a form titled ‚ÄúSurvivorRx Founding Member.‚Äù The form was designed to collect personal information and, in some reported cases, resulted in unauthorized charges. This form has now been removed, and we continue to work with the appropriate authorities and partners to protect our community.

These emails and this form are not from SurvivorRx. While we sometimes reach out to customers by email, any request for information will always direct you to our official website or secure customer portal. We will never ask for payment or highly sensitive personal details (such as financial information) through an unsolicited form or unfamiliar web link.

What the Scam Messages Look Like

The scam emails and forms may contain language such as:

  • ‚ÄúSurvivorRx Founding Member‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúAs a Founding Member at SurvivorRx ‚Äì we want your advice.‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúYour answers are going to shape the future of SurvivorRx. You have an influential role.‚Äù

The form may ask for:

  • First and last name
  • Email address
  • Questions about supplements you‚Äôre interested in
  • Whether you would join a SurvivorRx community forum

It often closes with a reference to a supposed launch date and a promise that ‚Äúnext steps‚Äù will be emailed. While this may sound legitimate, it is not from us ‚Äî it is a ploy to collect personal details for fraudulent purposes.

How to Verify a Legitimate SurvivorRx Email

Genuine SurvivorRx emails will:

  • Always come from an @survivorrx.com address
  • Never request sensitive financial details through an unsolicited form link
  • Include our official contact details so you can verify the sender

How to Protect Yourself

If you receive one of these fraudulent emails:

  • Do not click any links or fill out any forms
  • Mark the email as spam in your inbox
  • Report the incident to the FBI‚Äôs Internet Crime Complaint Center at www.ic3.gov
  • Forward the message (with full email headers if possible) to hello@survivorrx.com so we can assist in the investigation
  • Delete the message from your inbox and trash folder

Our Commitment to You

We know scams like this can cause unnecessary stress, and we want to reassure our customers and survivor community that your safety, trust, and wellbeing are at the heart of everything we do. We are actively working with security experts and law enforcement to put an end to this impersonation.

Our systems and online store remain secure ‚Äî this scam is entirely external, and no SurvivorRx accounts or orders have been compromised.

If you ever receive a message that doesn‚Äôt feel quite right, please take a moment to confirm it with us before responding. We‚Äôre here to help, and we‚Äôll always be happy to verify whether a communication is truly from SurvivorRx.
